qas.question: What is the official name of Portugal?
What type of language is Portuguese?
What was the common name of the Galician and Portuguese people?

context: <a0_0>Portuguese<a0_0/> is the official language of Portugal. Portuguese is a <a1_0>Romance<a1_0/> language that originated in what is now <a2_0>Galicia and Northern Portugal<a2_0/>, originating from <a3_0>Galician-Portuguese<a3_0/>, which was the common language of the Galician and Portuguese people until the independence of Portugal. Particularly in the North of Portugal, there are still many similarities between the Galician culture and the Portuguese culture. Galicia is a consultative observer of the Community of Portuguese Language Countries. According to the Ethnologue of Languages, Portuguese and Spanish have a lexical similarity of 89% - educated speakers of each language can communicate easily with one another.
